alert.note: Alert for Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 7:02PM CST until February 10 at 1:54AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County. South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Kaufman, Rockwall and Hunt Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Major out of bank flooding will occur. Major flooding will occur through Greenville downstream to below the Interstate 30 bridge. Street closures will be required, and a few rural roads will be underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue gradually falling over the next several days. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
